chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
Sex with Child Age 16 or Older

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

supervisions.notes:
--To commence consecutive to any other sentence in being

JAIL SENTENCES ARE IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent.

7/1/16: It is hereby Ordered that the judgment of conviction in the above captioned case is modified to allow the defendant to serve the imposed and stayed portion of each count in his sentence in the Dane County Jail as long as it is under the same conditions as provided for in the Jefferson County Jail and without electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence in being

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $243 
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge

--AODA Assessment within 60 days of disposition & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possesion or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Undergo a psychosexual evaluation and follow-through with any treatment recommended, per Agent
--No unsupervised contact with minor females, except as approved by Agent and incidental public contact for employment purposes
--No access to the internet, except as permitted by Agent
--Sex offender registry pursuant to 301.45
--No contact with A.N.G. and no presence at or within 1000 feet of her residence or school

Arresting Agency:  Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

It is hereby Ordered that the judgment of conviction in the above captioned case is modified to allow the defendant to serve the imposed and stayed portion of each count in his sentence in the Dane County Jail as long as it is under the same conditions as provided for in the Jefferson County Jail and without electronic monitoring.
Stipulation and  for Modification of JOC
with elements/JI's and criminal case settlement

Case called at 1:40 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Andrew R Schmidt in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #2, #3, #4 & #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1
ADA Beck submits victim impact statement

On Counts #2 & #3, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges on Count #3 only; each count, to commence: Count #2 consecutive to any other sentence in being and Count #3 consecutive to Count #2
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.

On Counts #4 & #5, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, each count, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence concurrent to Count #2 & to each other
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/Work-Release privileges without further process.

JAIL SENTENCES ARE IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment within 60 days of disposition & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possesion or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Undergo a psychosexual evaluation and follow-through with any treatment recommended, per Agent
--No unsupervised contact with minor females, except as approved by Agent and incidental public contact for employment purposes
--No access to the internet, except as permitted by Agent
--Sex offender registry pursuant to 301.45
--No contact with A.N.G. and no presence at or within 1000 feet of her residence or school
--To pay costs of $972 ($243 each count)
--To pay $800 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)

Days credit for time already served: 79 days
Court orders Mr. Schmidt to report to probation by 12:00 pm 11/14/14
Recess: 2:16 pm
Psychosexual evaluation
Status conference on November 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 5, 2014 at 11:20 am.
Scheduling Notice

Defendant Andrew R Schmidt in court with attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Cases 13CM402, 13CM442 & 14CF84 called together at 10:38 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Andrew R Schmidt in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to 14CF84: Atty Svehlek informs the Court that this matter has not yet been resolved; requests this matter be set for DA PTC & STC, with STC about 6 weeks out, presents basis

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-13CM402 & Count #1-13CM442; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, orders JOC entered.
DA Happ submits victim impact statement for case 13CM442

On Count #1-13CM402, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence consecutive to any other previously imposed sentence
--23 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443 + $10 summons fees = $453; due in $35 increments per month beginning 12/31/14 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 19 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

On Count #1-13CM442, the Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence consecutive to 13CM402 & any other previously imposed sentence
--11 days credit for time already served given
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--pay costs of $243 + $200 DNA Surcharge = $443 + $33 summons fees + 10% restitution processing fee ($167) = $643 ; due in $35 increments per month beginning 12/31/14 and on the last day of the month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment results in a 26 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Court enters civil judgment against Mr. Schmidt in favor of Sherry Filenius in the amount of $1600, for restitution
--Court enters civil judgment against Mr. Schmidt in favor of Brad Stewart C/O American Pawn & Trade in the amount of $70, for restitution
Recess: 11:06 am

Case called at 1:16 pm
Defendant Andrew R Schmidt in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa Jefferson County Public Defenders Office.  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney De La Rosa informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews conflict review worksheet. Court finds no conflict and signs the conflict review worksheet.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Counts #1 - #5.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $350.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with A.N.G. 
-No unsupervised contact with minors

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:36 pm

PTC: 3/26/14 at 10:40 am
Status: 4/8/14 at 3:00 pm (set along with def's other cases 13CM402 & 13CM442)
